00079    static int cleanup();

00081    static int bind(UDTSOCKET u, const sockaddr* name, int namelen);
00082    static int bind(UDTSOCKET u, UDPSOCKET udpsock);
00083    static int listen(UDTSOCKET u, int backlog);
00084    static UDTSOCKET accept(UDTSOCKET u, sockaddr* addr, int* addrlen);
00085    static int connect(UDTSOCKET u, const sockaddr* name, int namelen);
00086    static int close(UDTSOCKET u);
00087    static int getpeername(UDTSOCKET u, sockaddr* name, int* namelen);
00088    static int getsockname(UDTSOCKET u, sockaddr* name, int* namelen);
00089    static int getsockopt(UDTSOCKET u, int level, UDTOpt optname, void* optval, int* optlen);
00090    static int setsockopt(UDTSOCKET u, int level, UDTOpt optname, const void* optval, int optlen);
00091    static int send(UDTSOCKET u, const char* buf, int len, int flags);
00092    static int recv(UDTSOCKET u, char* buf, int len, int flags);
00093    static int sendmsg(UDTSOCKET u, const char* buf, int len, int ttl = -1, bool inorder = false);
00094    static int recvmsg(UDTSOCKET u, char* buf, int len);
00095    static int64_t sendfile(UDTSOCKET u, std::fstream& ifs, int64_t& offset, const int64_t& size, const int& block = 364000);
00096    static int64_t recvfile(UDTSOCKET u, std::fstream& ofs, int64_t& offset, const int64_t& size, const int& block = 7280000);
00097    static int select(int nfds, ud_set* readfds, ud_set* writefds, ud_set* exceptfds, const timeval* timeout);
00098    static int selectEx(const std::vector<UDTSOCKET>& fds, std::vector<UDTSOCKET>* readfds, std::vector<UDTSOCKET>* writefds, std::vector<UDTSOCKET>* exceptfds, int64_t msTimeOut);
00099    static int epoll_create();
00100    static int epoll_add_usock(const int eid, const UDTSOCKET u, const int* events = NULL);
00101    static int epoll_add_ssock(const int eid, const SYSSOCKET s, const int* events = NULL);
00102    static int epoll_remove_usock(const int eid, const UDTSOCKET u, const int* events = NULL);
00103    static int epoll_remove_ssock(const int eid, const SYSSOCKET s, const int* events = NULL);
00104    static int epoll_wait(const int eid, std::set<UDTSOCKET>* readfds, std::set<UDTSOCKET>* writefds, int64_t msTimeOut, std::set<SYSSOCKET>* lrfds = NULL, std::set<SYSSOCKET>* wrfds = NULL);
00105    static int epoll_release(const int eid);
00106    static CUDTException& getlasterror();

00108    static UDTSTATUS getsockstate(UDTSOCKET u);

00113 private:
00114       // Functionality:
00115       //    initialize a UDT entity and bind to a local address.
00116       // Parameters:
00117       //    None.
00118       // Returned value:
00119       //    None.
00120 
00121    void open();
00122 
00123       // Functionality:
00124       //    Start listening to any connection request.
00125       // Parameters:
00126       //    None.
00127       // Returned value:
00128       //    None.
00129 
00130    void listen();
00131 
00132       // Functionality:
00133       //    Connect to a UDT entity listening at address "peer".
00134       // Parameters:
00135       //    0) [in] peer: The address of the listening UDT entity.
00136       // Returned value:
00137       //    None.
00138 
00139    void connect(const sockaddr* peer);
00140 
00141       // Functionality:
00142       //    Connect to a UDT entity listening at address "peer", which has sent "hs" request.
00143       // Parameters:
00144       //    0) [in] peer: The address of the listening UDT entity.
00145       //    1) [in/out] hs: The handshake information sent by the peer side (in), negotiated value (out).
00146       // Returned value:
00147       //    None.
00148 
00149    void connect(const sockaddr* peer, CHandShake* hs);
00150 
00151       // Functionality:
00152       //    Close the opened UDT entity.
00153       // Parameters:
00154       //    None.
00155       // Returned value:
00156       //    None.
00157 
00158    void close();
00159       // Functionality:
00160       //    Request UDT to send out a data block "data" with size of "len".
00161       // Parameters:
00162       //    0) [in] data: The address of the application data to be sent.
00163       //    1) [in] len: The size of the data block.
00164       // Returned value:
00165       //    Actual size of data sent.
00166 
00167    int send(const char* data, const int& len);
00168 
00169       // Functionality:
00170       //    Request UDT to receive data to a memory block "data" with size of "len".
00171       // Parameters:
00172       //    0) [out] data: data received.
00173       //    1) [in] len: The desired size of data to be received.
00174       // Returned value:
00175       //    Actual size of data received.
00176 
00177    int recv(char* data, const int& len);
00178 
00179       // Functionality:
00180       //    send a message of a memory block "data" with size of "len".
00181       // Parameters:
00182       //    0) [out] data: data received.
00183       //    1) [in] len: The desired size of data to be received.
00184       //    2) [in] ttl: the time-to-live of the message.
00185       //    3) [in] inorder: if the message should be delivered in order.
00186       // Returned value:
00187       //    Actual size of data sent.
00188 
00189    int sendmsg(const char* data, const int& len, const int& ttl, const bool& inorder);
00190 
00191       // Functionality:
00192       //    Receive a message to buffer "data".
00193       // Parameters:
00194       //    0) [out] data: data received.
00195       //    1) [in] len: size of the buffer.
00196       // Returned value:
00197       //    Actual size of data received.
00198 
00199    int recvmsg(char* data, const int& len);
00200 
00201       // Functionality:
00202       //    Request UDT to send out a file described as "fd", starting from "offset", with size of "size".
00203       // Parameters:
00204       //    0) [in] ifs: The input file stream.
00205       //    1) [in, out] offset: From where to read and send data; output is the new offset when the call returns.
00206       //    2) [in] size: How many data to be sent.
00207       //    3) [in] block: size of block per read from disk
00208       // Returned value:
00209       //    Actual size of data sent.
00210 
00211    int64_t sendfile(std::fstream& ifs, int64_t& offset, const int64_t& size, const int& block = 366000);
00212 
00213       // Functionality:
00214       //    Request UDT to receive data into a file described as "fd", starting from "offset", with expected size of "size".
00215       // Parameters:
00216       //    0) [out] ofs: The output file stream.
00217       //    1) [in, out] offset: From where to write data; output is the new offset when the call returns.
00218       //    2) [in] size: How many data to be received.
00219       //    3) [in] block: size of block per write to disk
00220       // Returned value:
00221       //    Actual size of data received.
00222 
00223    int64_t recvfile(std::fstream& ofs, int64_t& offset, const int64_t& size, const int& block = 7320000);
00224 
00225       // Functionality:
00226       //    Configure UDT options.
00227       // Parameters:
00228       //    0) [in] optName: The enum name of a UDT option.
00229       //    1) [in] optval: The value to be set.
00230       //    2) [in] optlen: size of "optval".
00231       // Returned value:
00232       //    None.
00233 
00234    void setOpt(UDTOpt optName, const void* optval, const int& optlen);
00235 
00236       // Functionality:
00237       //    Read UDT options.
00238       // Parameters:
00239       //    0) [in] optName: The enum name of a UDT option.
00240       //    1) [in] optval: The value to be returned.
00241       //    2) [out] optlen: size of "optval".
00242       // Returned value:
00243       //    None.
00244 
00245    void getOpt(UDTOpt optName, void* optval, int& optlen);
00246 
00247       // Functionality:
00248       //    read the performance data since last sample() call.
00249       // Parameters:
00250       //    0) [in, out] perf: pointer to a CPerfMon structure to record the performance data.
00251       //    1) [in] clear: flag to decide if the local performance trace should be cleared.
00252       // Returned value:
00253       //    None.
00254 
00255    void sample(CPerfMon* perf, bool clear = true);

00278    int m_iFlightFlagSize;                       // Maximum number of packets in flight from the peer side
00279    int m_iSndBufSize;                           // Maximum UDT sender buffer size
00280    int m_iRcvBufSize;                           // Maximum UDT receiver buffer size
00281    linger m_Linger;                             // Linger information on close

00285    bool m_bRendezvous;                          // Rendezvous connection mode

00288    bool m_bReuseAddr;                           // reuse an exiting port or not, for UDP multiplexer
00289    int64_t m_llMaxBW;                           // maximum data transfer rate (threshold)

00296 private: // Status
00297    volatile bool m_bListening;                  // If the UDT entit is listening to connection
00298    volatile bool m_bConnected;                  // Whether the connection is on or off
00299    volatile bool m_bClosing;                    // If the UDT entity is closing
00300    volatile bool m_bShutdown;                   // If the peer side has shutdown the connection
00301    volatile bool m_bBroken;                     // If the connection has been broken
00302    volatile bool m_bPeerHealth;                 // If the peer status is normal
00303    bool m_bOpened;                              // If the UDT entity has been opened
00304    int m_iBrokenCounter;                        // a counter (number of GC checks) to let the GC tag this socket as disconnected
00305

00310    int m_iDeliveryRate;                         // Packet arrival rate at the receiver side

00355 
00356    pthread_mutex_t m_AckLock;                   // used to protected sender's loss list when processing ACK
00357

00359    pthread_mutex_t m_RecvDataLock;              // lock associated to m_RecvDataCond
00360 
00361    pthread_mutex_t m_SendLock;                  // used to synchronize "send" call
00362    pthread_mutex_t m_RecvLock;                  // used to synchronize "recv" call

00377    int64_t m_llSentTotal;                       // total number of sent data packets, including retransmissions
00378    int64_t m_llRecvTotal;                       // total number of received packets
00379    int m_iSndLossTotal;                         // total number of lost packets (sender side)
00380    int m_iRcvLossTotal;                         // total number of lost packets (receiver side)

00383    int m_iRecvACKTotal;                         // total number of received ACK packets

00392    int m_iTraceRcvLoss;                         // number of lost packets in the last trace interval (receiver side)
00393    int m_iTraceRetrans;                         // number of retransmitted packets in the last trace interval
00394    int m_iSentACK;                              // number of ACKs sent in the last trace interval
